intro: Austrobassia longicuspis, commonly known as the long-spined hakea, is a shrub native to southwestern Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils. Austrobassia longicuspis is an important component of the local flora and provides habitat for various native wildlife species.
